notes: An aragonite saturation state less than or equal to 1 is widely recognized as undersaturated and can be attributed as a threshold for acidification globally. For regions that are greater than 1, values are rescaled according to their amount of change compared to historical values

data_description: Mean Sea Level Anomaly (MSLA) as compared to a 20 year mean (meters)
notes: Annual means are aggregated from monthly data. No need for a historical comparison since the data comes computed against a 20 year mean.

data_description: Number of positive anomalies compared to historical reference
units: number of anomalous weeks in a year
notes: Reference point is the 99.99th quantile of the differences in anomalies between historical and recent years

data_description: Number of positive anomalies (weekly data from 1982-2012), defined as number >1sd from historical mean (1985-1989)
units: number of anomalous weeks in 5 yr period
notes: historical data was selected to avoid el nino years
Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)

data_description: Catch (tons per km2) standardized by primary productivity
units: tons per km2 standardized by primary productivity
notes: Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)

data_description: Catch (tons per km2) standardized by primary productivity
units: tons per km2 standardized by primary productivity
notes: Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)

data_description: Catch (tons per km2) standardized by primary productivity
units: tons per km2 standardized by primary productivity
notes: Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)

data_description: Modeled FAO fertilizer data based on land-use data
notes: Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)

data_description: Modeled FAO pesticide data based on land-use data
notes: Reference point is log value (entire layer log transformed before rescaled)
